message.content:
cs.DL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CL 

The paper introduces a quantitative method for analyzing the historical roots and impact of research fields based on citation analysis. This method can be applied to various fields, but the examples given in the paper are graphene and solar cells, which are both related to materials science and engineering. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.DL (Digital Libraries) which deals with information retrieval and management. Other likely sub-categories include cs.IR (Information Retrieval), cs.SI (Social and Information Networks), cs.CY (Computational Geometry), and cs.CL (Computation and Language) which all involve analysis and processing of large datasets and/or text.
